**Eternal Scholar**: As an eternal scholar, you would dedicate your eternity to the pursuit of knowledge. You would read every book, study every subject, and learn every skill. You would delve into the depths of science, art, history, and philosophy, always striving to expand your understanding of the world and the universe.

**Eternal Mentor**: As an eternal mentor, you would use your immortality to help others. You would offer guidance, wisdom, and support to those in need, becoming a beacon of hope and inspiration for generations to come. You would teach, coach, and mentor people from all walks of life, helping them to reach their full potential and achieve their dreams.

**Eternal Creator**: As an eternal creator, you would use your immortality to express yourself through art, music, writing, or any other form of creative expression. You would create masterpieces that would stand the test of time, inspiring others and leaving a lasting legacy. You would experiment with new forms of art and push the boundaries of what is possible, always striving to create something truly original and unique.

**Eternal Activist**: As an eternal activist, you would dedicate your eternity to fighting for social justice and equality. You would work tirelessly to bring about positive change in the world, advocating for the rights of marginalized communities and working to create a more just and equitable society. You would use your immortality to inspire others to join the cause and make a difference.

**Eternal Philosopher**: As an eternal philosopher, you would use your immortality to contemplate the meaning of life and the nature of existence. You would explore the depths of your own consciousness and seek to understand the universe and the human condition. You would write profound treatises and engage in thought-provoking debates, always striving to expand your understanding of the world and your place in it.
